#Text=Canada 's St. Paul ’s West ( Ward 21 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Friday , November 3 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontonians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is St. Paul 's West ( Ward 21 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include John Adams , Tony Corpuz , Joe Mihevc ( incumbent ) , and John Sewell .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Joe Mihevc ( incumbent )
#Text=54-year-old Joe Mihevc is the incumbent for Ward 21 , St. Paul 's West , Toronto , Canada .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A : The three most important issues are the environment , transportation and the local economy .
#Text=As Toronto plans for its future , we need to increase our waste diversion and recycling programs .
#Text=We need to maintain and protect our green spaces .
#Text=We need to enhance sustainable energy options .
#Text=We need to reduce gridlock and smog in order to improve our air quality .
#Text=And , we need an efficient , affordable , reliable transit system to keep the City and local economy moving .
#Text=In addressing each of these issues , I am convinced that we cannot make decisions for today only ; we need to have vision and hope for a brighter future .
#Text=As Councillor , I have worked , and will continue to work , on each of these issues in many separate and specific projects throughout the Ward and City .
#Text=For a full record of the positive results of my work on these issues , go to www . joemihevc . ca
#Text=All three of the issues come together in one local project – the rejeuvenation of St. Clair Ave W , which I address in the next question .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?

#Text=A : The majority of residents have indicated to me that they want St. Clair , the Avenue at the centre of our community life in the south of Ward 21 , to provide them with reliable public transit , an efficient flow of traffic , and sidewalks that draw neighbours out for a stroll or to shop locally .

#Text=This is the vision towards which we are working ! With streetscape and transit improvements , St. Clair West will continue to be pedestrian-friendly , and I will continue to encourage the growing patio culture for restaurants and cafes .
#Text=To improve public transit , I support a dedicated lane that will allow streetcars to pass unobstructed along the street .
#Text=In terms of reliability , we are getting the equivalent of an above ground subway service – the dream of so many neighbourhoods across the city !
#Text=How can I not support that as the local Councillor , responsible for enhancing the Ward which I represent ?
#Text=Current levels of transit service are already insufficient here and will become more so as St. Clair increases in density and popularity .
#Text=Improved public transit is vital to preserving the neighbourhood character of St. Clair , while moving us into the future .
